data.title: NexTech3D AI reports preliminary unaudited 2024 revenue of $3.1million
data.description:
• Nextech3D.AI (OTCQB:NEXCF) on Tuesday reported preliminary unaudited 2024 revenue of $3.1 million and gross profit of $1.9 million. 
  • Looking ahead to 2025, NexTech3D AI is tracking a projected gross profit margin of 80%+ by the end of the year.
  • Source: Press Release

data.title: McDonald's bring back Uncle O'Grimacey after 40 years as its sales-driven trip down memory lane continues
data.description:
McDonald's Corporation (NYSE:MCD) continues to lean on nostalgia as a sales driver after the return of the Grimace Birthday Meal, the launch of CosMc's, and the use of Hamburglar in promotions again all created viral buzz.

Next in line is Uncle O'Grimacey, who is Grimace's Irish uncle and has not been seen in a few decades. Uncle O'Grimacey shares a similar shape to his nephew Grimace, featuring a round body with short arms and legs.

In terms of the menu, the restaurant operator said the Shamrock Shake, a milkshake made with vanilla soft-serve ice cream, mint-flavored green syrup and whipped topping, will return to restaurants on February 10. The Shamrock Shake has been on McDonald's seasonal menu for more than 50 years. In addition, the Oreo Shamrock McFlurry, made with vanilla soft-serve, minty green syrup and Oreo cookie pieces, will also be on the menu.

As part of a promotion that runs from February 10 to March 23, every Shamrock Shake sold at participating McDonald's (NYSE:MCD) will see $0.25 go to Ronald McDonald House Charities, with a goal of raising $5 million. That campaign also features new Uncle O'Grimacey merchandise, available exclusively at Golden Arches Unlimited, purchases of which will lead to more to Ronald McDonald House Charities.

Looking ahead, McDonald's (NYSE:MCD) is lined up to report Q4 earnings on February 10. Analysts expect revenue of $6.5 billion and EPS of $2.86 to be disclosed.

Shares of McDonald's (MCD) were up 0.1% in early trading and are essentially flat for the year.

data.title: Brenmiller Energy to launch thermal energy storage system to electrify thermal oil
data.description:
Brenmiller Energy (NASDAQ:BNRG) +17.6% in early trading Tuesday after saying it started development of the bGen ZERO thermal energy storage system designed to electrify thermal oil for industrial applications.

Planned for commercial availability in 2026, bGen ZTO expands Brenmiller’s (NASDAQ:BNRG) total addressable market into the $8B annual thermal oil heating equipment market.

Thermal oil, which is used for industrial heating processes of pharmaceuticals, chemicals, petrochemicals, and food processing industries, currently is 95% powered by fossil fuels.

Brenmiller (BNRG) said bGen ZTO is a modular thermal energy storage system that will combine an internal electric conversion for storage with integrated heat exchange, achieving nearly 100% cycle efficiency while heating thermal oil up to 340°C.

data.title: Dow, S&P, and Nasdaq look for direction as China hits back with tariffs on U.S. imports
data.description:
Wall Street looks for direction on Tuesday as China retaliated with a levy of tariffs on imports of multiple U.S. products.

Early on and the S&P 500 (SP500) was near even, the Nasdaq Composite (COMP:IND) was +0.1%, and the Dow (DJI) was -0.1%.

The 10-year Treasury yield (US10Y) rose 2 basis points to 4.58%. The 2-year yield (US2Y) rose 1 basis point to 4.26%.

The tech focused Nasdaq has been helped by shares of Palantir Technologies (PLTR) which popped over 20% after the firm's fourth quarter 2024 results and outlook blasted past expectations.

On the tariff front, the Chinese government said it would implement a 15% tariff on coal and liquefied natural gas products, as well as a 10% tariff on crude oil, agricultural machinery, and large-displacement cars.

Wall Street closed lower on Monday after President Donald Trump announced new tariffs on Canada and Mexico over the weekend. While it was a red day, markets were able to recoup some earlier losses after delays were announced against tariffs towards Mexico.

"The past 24 hours have seen a big roundtrip for many assets classes as strongly negative sentiment gave way to a relief rally on news that the planned 25% tariffs against Mexico and Canada would be delayed," Deutsche Bank's Jim Reid said.

"Taxing goods from China is still happening, and China has retaliated. The inflation consequences of these taxes are less obvious to US consumers," UBS' Paul Donovan said.

On the earnings side, Google parent Alphabet (GOOGL) (GOOG) is expected to release its fourth quarter results today.

Traders are also awaiting the December Job Openings and Labor Turnover Survey report, which will land shortly, and is expected to fall to 8.010M.

U.S. job vacancy data is due. The survey response rate is tiny, making the data an imprecise guide, Donovan said.

data.title: Exodus Movement announces offer to acquire Banxa
data.description:
• Exodus Movement (NYSE:EXOD) on Tuesday said it has submitted a proposal for the acquisition of all the issued and outstanding common shares of financial technology platform Banxa Holdings (TSXV:BNXA:CA).
  • Banxa said that its Board of Directors has unanimously determined that the Exodus Offer constitutes a “Superior Proposal” under the terms of the arrangement agreement between Banxa and 1493819 B.C.
  • Banxa also announced that it provided notice of such determination to 1493819 and that, under its arrangement agreement with 1493819, 1493819 now has the right, until February 10, to propose to amend the terms of the arrangement agreement in order to make the Exodus Offer no longer a Superior Proposal.
  • Pursuant to the terms of the offer, Exodus has offered to acquire all of the issued and outstanding common shares of Banxa for consideration per Banxa Share comprised of CDN$1.10 in cash and 0.0079 of class A common stock of Exodus.
  • Source: Press Release

data.title: Fox shares rise as cable network, television strength drive results beat
data.description:
Shares of mass media conglomerate Fox (NASDAQ:FOXA) rose nearly 7% on Tuesday after it posted a top-and-bottom line beat for its fiscal 2025 second quarter results, driven by double-digit percentage growth in its cable network programming and television businesses.

In its cable business, the company generated revenue of $2.17B, up by more than 30% from a year ago, while television brought in $2.96B, up 16%.

Adjusted EBITDA in Q2 more than doubled to $781M, helped by the revenue increase and partially offset by higher expenses.

In Q2, the company bought back about $250M of its Class A common stock and has about $900M remaining under the current buyback program. As of December 31, 2024, it repurchased about $5.1B of its Class A shares and nearly $1B of Class B shares.

"A compelling fall sports schedule combined with a record-breaking presidential election news cycle resulted in second quarter results that reflect the strength and breadth of FOX. Whether measured in terms of engagement, monetization, or profitability, our focused strategy of live news and sports programming, coupled with our growing digital initiatives, continues to deliver. We remain committed to sustained long-term value creation for our shareholders through our thoughtful and disciplined strategy for growth," CEO Lachlan Murdoch said in a statement.

For the three months ended December 31, the company reported net income attributable to shareholders was $373M, or $0.81 per share, compared to the $109M, or $0.23 per share, for the same period last year.

On an adjusted basis, the company earned 96 cents apiece, beating the average Wall Street analyst expectation of 62 cents.

Revenue rose more than 20% to $5.08B and beat the consensus mark by nearly $260M.

Fox also declared a dividend of $0.27 per Class A and Class B share; payable on March 26, 2025 with a record date for determining dividend entitlements of March 5, 2025.

data.title: Willis Towers Watson Q4 earnings jump with revenue, operating margin
data.description:
Willis Towers Watson (NASDAQ:WTW) on Tuesday delivered Q4 earnings that surged past the average analyst estimate, while revenue missed the mark.

Nonetheless, the insurance broker "is entering 2025 with considerable momentum after delivering on our 2024 financial targets through solid revenue growth, robust margin expansion and earnings growth,” said CEO Carl Hess.

Q4 adjusted EPS of $8.13, topping the $8.03 consensus, jumped from $2.93 in the previous quarter and $7.44 in Q4 2023.

Revenue of $3.04B, trailing the $3.05B expected, accelerated from $2.29B in Q3 and $2.91B in the year-ago period.

WTW shares retreated 2% in premarket trading.

Adjusted operating margin was 36.1% for the three-month period ended Dec. 31, 2024, rose from 18.1% in Q2 and 34.2% a year earlier.

The firm's Health, Wealth & Career division saw its operating margin rise 140 basis points to 41.9% Y/Y in Q4, and its Risk & Brokering arm's operating margin gained 60 bps over the same period.

data.title: 4 stocks to watch on Tuesday: PFE, GOOG/GOOGL and more
data.description:
U.S. stock index futures on Tuesday were mixed amid small moves, as investors waded through more tariff drama and another deluge of quarterly earnings. Here are some stocks to watch on Tuesday:

  • Shares of Pfizer (PFE) gained more than 1% in pre-market trading, after the pharmaceutical major delivered a Q4 top- and bottom-line beat. Notably, Pfizer's (PFE) Q4 revenue jumped 21% Y/Y, as sales from its portfolio of non-COVID drugs rose 11%. The company also reaffirmed all components of its full-year 2025 guidance. "Last year we had a significant emphasis on improving our commercial effectiveness. In 2025 the emphasis will move to improving R&D productivity, while maintaining focus on margin expansion, commercial excellence and shareholder friendly capital allocation," top boss Albert Bourla said in prepared remarks.
  • PepsiCo (PEP) stock slipped 2.5%, after the soft drinks giant reported Q4 organic sales growth that missed expectations. Overall net revenue decreased 0.2%, as volume fell in PepsiCo's (PEP) North American Frito-Lay and Quaker Foods segments. CEO Ramon Laguarta noted "subdued category performance trends in North America, the continued impacts related to a recall in our Quaker Foods North America division and business disruptions due to geopolitical tensions in certain international markets." PEP expects to deliver low-single-digit organic revenue growth and mid-single-digit core constant currency EPS growth in 2025.
  • Shares of PayPal (PYPL) slumped more than 8% ahead of market open, after the payment technology firm's Q4 margin weakness overshadowed strong profit guidance. PayPal's (PYPL) GAAP operating margin contracted 431 basis points to 17.2%, as the company faces increasing competition in its key payments processing business. “PayPal had a strong finish to a successful 2024 with results that were better than we expected," chief executive Alex Chriss said, adding that the improvements the company had made to branded checkout, peer-topeer, and Venmo, plus the progress it had made on its price-to-value strategy, was beginning to show up in its results.
  • Alphabet (GOOG)(GOOGL) stock will be in focus, ahead of the Google-parent's Q4 results after the closing bell. Wall Street expects the Mountain View, Calif.-based firm to earn $2.13 per share on revenue of $96.67B. That top-line figure is anticipated to rise 12% Y/Y, driven by healthy digital advertising demand and growth in the cloud business. Following Meta Platforms' (META) solid advertising sales performance, that same strength is seen showing up in both Google Search and YouTube. Analysts will also want to hear management's thought on DeepSeek and artificial intelligence.

data.title: CleanSpark produces 626 Bitcoin in January
data.description:
• CleanSpark (NASDAQ:CLSK) produced 626 Bitcoin in January. Total bitcoin holdings as of January 31 of 10,556.
  • Throughout January 2025, the company's average hashrate was 34.76 EH/s and average fleet efficiency was 17.37 J/Th, resulting in an average of 20.19 bitcoin mined daily.
  • The company sold 22.47 bitcoin during January 2025 at an average price of ~$100,412 per bitcoin.
  • CLSK shares fall 1.2% premarket on Tuesday.
  • Source: Press release

data.title: Air Products names Menezes as new CEO; Ghasemi to depart
data.description:
Air Products (NYSE:APD) said it appointed Eduardo Menezes as its new CEO effective February 7, succeeding Seifi Ghasemi, who is leaving the company after more than 10 years of service.

Menezes brings extensive international experience in all key sectors of industrial gases, most recently as executive VP of Linde for Europe, Middle East and Africa, with responsibility for operations in more than 40 countries with $8B-plus in sales and 18K employees.

Air Products (NYSE:APD) also named Wayne Smith as its new Chairman, after serving on the board since 2021; he brings 35 years of senior management experience in the chemicals industries, most recently as Chairman and CEO of BASF during 2015-21.

Air Products (APD) has been involved in a proxy fight witha investor Mantle Ridge, which won three board seats and fought to oust Ghasemi.
